{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3752890,"name":"Berk","username":"BerkSadyam","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-10-01T13:20:07.541Z","cooked":"

I am tryong to configure my radio to robot mlde after competition software but i dont know how to do it how can i do

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-10-01T16:51:15.231Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":94.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506764,"topic_slug":"how-to-reset-vh109-radio-after-competition","display_username":"Berk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71572,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-reset-vh109-radio-after-competition/506764/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3752894,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-10-01T13:33:13.039Z","cooked":"

Connect to it via ethernet.

Navigate to 10.te.am.1

Follow the vivid hosting instructions.

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/programming-your-radio-at-home

It’s a 30 second exercise and seems to work far better than the old radios. It was a pleasure.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-10-01T13:33:13.039Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":59.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506764,"topic_slug":"how-to-reset-vh109-radio-after-competition","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/programming-your-radio-at-home","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Programming Your Radio At Home | FIRST FRC Radio","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-reset-vh109-radio-after-competition/506764/2","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3753127,"name":"tkchan","username":"tkchan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-10-01T17:47:14.405Z","cooked":"

make sure you set your computer’s ethernet to be in the same 10.te.am.X range. depending on how you guys allocate your IP range. I would suggested either use your DS number or if not sure, use something in the high range (i.e. 100, 150, etc). Or if you only connect between the radio (VH109) and the computer, then any (100) should also work.

Setting the laptop’s ethernet to DHCP should work by itself. If you do set up a static IP (I like to do so on the Driver Station so that it connects slightly faster) the final octet of the IP should be less than 20, so that it doesn’t cause any conflicts with DHCP assigned addresses. I just use 10.te.am.5 for the driver station as suggested in IP Configurations — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

We run all static IPs only on our robot for build season. For us, anything above 20 are free game. Should have mentioned that.
